content.label: Great graphic but slow
Absolutely LOVED it! What creativity!

title.label: A stinker: promoting cigarettes in the app

content.label: I was surprised, not in a good way, to see a scene showing the main character smoking cigarettes in a cool romantic setting and this is for an App that is promoted for +4 years. If you  don't support cigarettes advertisements to underage kids and don't buy this app.

I really enjoyed this. I found it so soothing. It was like taking a beautiful trip and getting stumbled up just a little bit now and again. The artwork is beautiful and uncluttered throughout, and the music was really enjoyable. I’m looking forward to checking out more from this studio.
Simple but fun game.

This app is beautifully produced, but it took me very little time to understand how it works and to finish the story. I would have liked more interactive elements, more variety in puzzle solutions, and/or a longer story. Feeling a little duped for paying the full $4.99 price.

This game is beautiful. The story told a lot without saying much. The game invoked a lot of emotions throughout the game through the music and images. The puzzles were nice and made the game worth playing. Definitely worth playing.
This is literally the most boring thing I ever did with a phone and I’m asking for my money back.
I like the pace of game play. I don’t mind it being slow...However, the fact that the game is over after just a few hours of play is a Rip-Off (!) at $5....

title.label: Antidote to the common screen time

content.label: Come and get lost in a storybook where the lush landscape moves just enough to let you progress from puzzle to puzzle, traversing meadows, mountains, a bay, even the sky. This game is beautiful in its own right, but the beauty for me and my children right now was the peace of the gameplay. The music, the images, the story, the game play that is manageable for my 5-year-old, intriguing for my 9-year-old, and challenging enough that I had to slow down and think and try different approaches here and there. Most of all - no buttons, no prompts, no counters of achievements in the corners, no reminders to come back or the old man would suffer, just hills and waves and the occasional sheep. And how many games can you play on your iPad that almost bring you to tears? I’m sure my boys don’t understand the emotional weight of the story, but they are enjoying every step of the journey anyway.
Play this game. It is beautiful. It is fun. It is one of the most moving storylines in video game history.
A story of regret and remorse may not be fun, but the puzzles are
Not as satisfying as I had hoped. Instead of challenging the gameplay became tedious after the novelty wore off. The music and art were mostly okay, and the story was obvious and unoriginal.

title.label: Looks good but not really worth it.

content.label:
The Ups: Graphics & Story
The Downs: Gameplay & Controls
The Verdict: Good for children and adults that like very little challenge.

Pleasing graphics and a touching story but that’s about it. Very simple gameplay with very little challenge (first half of the game almost none at all) and the controls although very simple can become very annoying at times especially in certain areas. I saw the game all over Appstore but then waited and bought it when it was $1 if I’m not mistaken and I’m happy I did. Definitely not worth its full price for me.

title.label: When it Was Over I cried into my pillow... 41 yo CIS WM

content.label: Bravo

This game truly was made for those moments when things outside are at their worst. It makes you slow down savor it and cultivates a stillness of mind and soul that is both rejuvenating and meditative.
Thank you
Loved this game and the story eeaved throughout!

title.label: Lightly touches on regret and loss

content.label: Lovely graphics combined with repetitive, easy puzzling, combined with a theme of regret, loss and redemption. Pretty, but for me not much depth either in the puzzles or the story.
The art, the story, all beautiful. I hope we see another like it someday.

I really LOVED this game.  In addition to the stunning art and reflective melodies, there is a tranquility to this game that calmed me as I walked through it.  Old Man’s Journey made me think about the journey of life, its storms, fond memories of youth, loss and sorrow.  Maybe this game hit me at exactly the right point in my life to have such an impact, but I see why this is an ‘editors choice’ game.
the title says it all

This game was not only beautiful to look at, calming to play, and unique in its gameplay, but also had a really nice soundtrack and a story that really got me into the game. I really got attached to the characters! It was just really pleasant and makes you think about life. I just finished playing it for the second time :)

If you are a reader and art lover you will thoroughly enjoy this game. The narrative unfolds upon each ‘checkpoint’ as the protagonist sits down to rest and has a subsequent flashback spurred by player interactions with the environment. For example the old man will sit and after pressing a nearby boat the boat will blow its foghorn and the sound brings to his mind a memory and the player is presented with a single image of a flashback. The flashbacks are all in chronological order and require the reader to piece them together in order to understand the narrative. Besides the storytelling, gameplay consist of raising and lowering the landscape in order to provide a passageway for the character. The challenge is simple enough—as many poor reviews will tell you, but these clearly stopped playing at the games beginning— the the puzzles do grow more difficult and intricate down the road. Besides gameplay, The artwork is stunning, each environment is fresh, original, and dynamic; as the narrative grows more turbulent the weather will become increasingly stormy and so on. That being said if you require fast paced addictive stimulation do not waste your time trying to enjoy this masterpiece. I feel many bad reviews come from the types of gamers accustomed (spoiled) by games that do everything for them in terms of storytelling and fast paced action. If you have the patience and perceptive facilities required to enjoy a fine novel or a walk in the park do give it a try. If not steer clear!
This game looked beautiful which is why it got 2 stars but I would hardly call this a puzzle game. Moving the hills up and down is not a puzzle!
Love it

A meaningful game with beautiful graphics, lovely music, and relatable story. It’s can be a bit frustrating at times to get where you need to go but for the most part pretty relaxing. I enjoyed some of the small interactions you can have with the scenery. Overall not a challenging game, but what you are left with when you finish the game is the point.

title.label: This is my favorite thing to do & play😃😃😃😃😃😃

content.label: I am 7 years old & this week I finished this game.  I loved this game👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻😃😃😃😃😃😃😃🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳🥳
Simple, well made, beautiful. A pleasure to play and take my mind off the world for a couple of minutes

The puzzles are the exact same each level! You move hills up and down, up and down. Every once and awhile, you move sheep. These extremely simplistic “puzzles” don’t make sense, and are so much more frustrating than enjoyable. The only good thing I have to say about this game, is the art style is beautiful, and nice. So, if you want to spend $5 to look at a nice picture, this is the game for you.

I only got 1.5 hours of gameplay out of it, which is not a lot for 5 bucks. I bought because it is supposed to have an excellent narrative, but it wasnt actually too good.  The graphics were beautiful!

Music is super amazing
Story is kinda nice
Game play is smooth
Puzzels are super easy to solve
Objects in the background are interactive and I really appreciate the details
The atmosphere is awesome 
And... unfortunately the gameplay is short
But in general its a really beautiful game and well made and polished 
Thank you ❤️

title.label: I’m not sure how this got so many stars

content.label: A man acted selfishly and hurt everyone he supposedly loved. It was really depressing. Were we supposed to feel sorry for him? I sure didn’t. And it was a little creepy at the end. I’m assuming that was his daughter he was with, so where did the little one come from? Creepy. I’m glad I didn’t pay full price for this. It was a pretty story, but there wasn’t much to it.
I loved this game, the illustration and story were beautiful. The only complaint I have is that the game isn’t longer!

This game is a complete disappointment and very frustrating! There are no instructions and basically, as far as I can determine, all you do is direct the travels of an old character across the screen by raising and lowering landscape components with your finger. Problem is, the programming is poor and the character does not typically go where you touch on the screen, often times in a completely different area of the screen and the manipulation of the landscape (you have to get areas to intersect so he can walk across them) is very erratic. Some of the art work is pleasant, but all you do is view it. You do not interact with it in any meaningful way. To top it off, you don't even know why he is walking wherever he is walking!!! This is not a game. It is a frustration and I am not sure if there is anyone I would recommend it to. To be honest, I got so bored with it I eventually deleted it and never finished it.
games aren’t usually this good

The artwork - beautiful. The music - peaceful. The puzzles - intriguing and challenging. The story - heartbreaking. 
Overall, this game was such a calming experience. I was so sad when I had finished it, because I enjoyed playing it so much!

This “game” provided a very sweet and heart wrenching story that I believe will compel most players to play on.  However, the game play somehow feels incomplete.   Unlike the richly developed story,  I could not help but feel the game aspect was lacking.   I felt like the developers were onto something with the design of the game, but the obstacles just felt contrived so as to call it a “game”.   At the risk of sounding redundant,  It seem like the developers had all the materials to make an interesting game, but in the end - it felt like they could have done much more to make it more compelling.

It’s a fun game, there is some redundancy I wanted to move on with. Great graphics, nice sound track. Couple of puzzles you have to really think about. Over all a good time, although slightly overpriced.

This game is so hard! I paid for it and I thought it seemed good and fun, but after I got past the first THREE levels I realized how frustrated it was making me. I am so sorry, this game just makes me frustrated and I would appreciate it if you added hints so I can use some help on the parts I don’t know. But other than that, this game is astonishing in every way. The use of colors, the story, the adventure, the puzzles... all incredible! Thank you for this game.
Great Game. Storytelling kept me wanting more.
Too much music. But I liked the game/challenge.
Relaxing little game, pleasant to look at, soft music. Played this before going to bed...cleared my head.
Beautiful, artful game. Made me cry like a baby. Highly recommend.
Nice change of pace game that mixes the mystery of puzzle solving with the mystery of life.  Very much enjoyed it!
My kind of game - richly aesthetic, lovely story, and just enough challenge to engage (not enrage!).  So thankful to those who developed the art and storyline.

title.label: Awesome game! You should definitely get it!

content.label:
Old Man’s Journey is a wonderful story, with meaningful emotions. This game is like a fun puzzle! Sometimes the old man will give you sad flashbacks- there kind of sad sometimes! you can travel through different places, and not to mention- the animation is top notch! 
	 No problems with the game! A game normally like this, would have problems like loading or something like that. But this game has no problem! If I could, I would give this game an award! 
	This game is an exciting journey, and amazing animation! This game is truly amazing! Please download today!
I was disappointed to see how quickly I went through the game, just several hours. It was not difficult, but I loved the story and the graphics were beautiful.

What the hell is the object?As a couple other apps I had to toss it because it wouldn’t respond to me trying to end the game on my new iPhone 11 super duper phone. But it makes no sense . When make something like this put some freaking directions in there.
I immediately regretted buying this. All it does is show you its graphics. They might have been awe inspiring when the game came out. Now, it’s just a waste of my hard earned money.
A fun, sweet puzzle saving game and story.
